questions.text: Which component is considered the 'brain' of the computer?
questions.explanation: The CPU (Central Processing Unit) is known as the brain of the computer as it performs most of the processing.

questions.text: True or False: RAM is a type of temporary storage that is erased when power is lost.
questions.explanation: RAM (Random Access Memory) is volatile memory, which means it loses its data when the power is turned off.

questions.text: What type of memory stores permanent data that cannot be easily modified?
questions.explanation: ROM (Read-Only Memory) stores data permanently and is used for firmware.

questions.text: Which part of the CPU performs arithmetic and logical operations?
questions.explanation: The Arithmetic Logic Unit (ALU) performs arithmetic and logical operations in the CPU.

questions.text: Which type of memory is used to increase the speed of data access for frequently used instructions?
questions.explanation: Cache memory stores frequently accessed data to improve processing speed.

questions.text: What is a system bus?
options: C. A pathway for data transmission inside a computer
D. A type of power supply
questions.correctAnswer: C. A pathway for data transmission inside a computer
questions.explanation: A system bus is a pathway that transfers data between components inside the computer.

questions.text: True or False: The motherboard is the main circuit board in a computer.
questions.explanation: The motherboard is the primary circuit board that holds the CPU, memory, and other essential components.

questions.text: Which component provides the main interface for connecting peripherals to the computer?
questions.explanation: Ports, such as USB and HDMI, provide interfaces for connecting external devices.

questions.text: What is the primary function of a power supply unit in a desktop computer?
options: C. To convert AC power to DC power
D. To connect to the network
questions.correctAnswer: C. To convert AC power to DC power
questions.explanation: The power supply converts AC power from the outlet to the DC power required by the computer components.

questions.text: Which memory type is used by the CPU to store data it is currently processing?
questions.explanation: RAM (Random Access Memory) temporarily holds data and programs that the CPU is currently using.

questions.text: True or False: Virtual memory is a section of a hard drive that is used as an extension of RAM.
questions.explanation: Virtual memory uses a portion of the hard drive to extend the capacity of RAM.

questions.text: Which of the following devices is used to cool the internal components of a computer?
questions.explanation: Cooling fans help regulate the temperature of the internal components to prevent overheating.

questions.text: What is the role of a heat sink?
options: C. To dissipate heat from components
questions.correctAnswer: C. To dissipate heat from components
questions.explanation: A heat sink absorbs and dissipates heat from components like the CPU to keep them cool.

questions.text: Which port is used for high-definition video and audio transmission to monitors?
questions.explanation: HDMI (High-Definition Multimedia Interface) is used for transmitting high-definition video and audio.

questions.text: What does BIOS stand for?
questions.explanation: BIOS is the Basic Input Output System that initializes hardware during the booting process.

questions.text: True or False: Flash memory is used to store BIOS settings.
questions.explanation: Flash memory is used to store BIOS settings as it retains data without power.

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of non-volatile memory?
questions.explanation: ROM (Read-Only Memory) retains its contents even when the power is turned off.

questions.text: What is the function of a network interface card (NIC)?
options: C. To connect to a network
questions.correctAnswer: C. To connect to a network
questions.explanation: A NIC (Network Interface Card) enables a computer to connect to a network.

questions.text: What type of memory is used to store the operating system and system files required to boot up the computer?
questions.explanation: ROM (Read-Only Memory) stores the firmware, which includes the operating system and boot files.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a type of bus found in computers?
questions.explanation: There is no such thing as a Heat Sink Bus; the other three are types of buses used for data transfer in computers.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a surge protector?
options: C. To protect against power surges
questions.correctAnswer: C. To protect against power surges
questions.explanation: Surge protectors prevent damage to electronic devices from sudden power spikes.

questions.text: True or False: The motherboard is also known as the system board.
questions.explanation: The motherboard is commonly referred to as the system board as it holds the primary components.

questions.text: Which of the following is the most common type of port used for external devices?
questions.explanation: USB (Universal Serial Bus) ports are the most common for connecting external devices like keyboards and mice.

questions.text: Which component is responsible for holding the instructions and data currently being processed by the CPU?
questions.explanation: RAM (Random Access Memory) temporarily holds data and instructions that the CPU is currently processing.

questions.text: What does the term 'bit' stand for?
questions.explanation: Bit stands for Binary Digit, the smallest unit of data in computing, representing either a 0 or a 1.

questions.text: True or False: A graphics card is an example of an adapter card that enhances the visual output of a computer.
questions.explanation: Graphics cards are adapter cards that enhance a computer's ability to render graphics and display visuals.

questions.text: What is a USB hub used for?
options: B. To expand the number of USB ports available
C. To connect to a Wi-Fi network
questions.correctAnswer: B. To expand the number of USB ports available
questions.explanation: A USB hub allows users to connect multiple devices to a single USB port by providing additional ports.

questions.text: Which of the following memory types is known for its high-speed access and is located within the CPU?
questions.explanation: Cache memory is a small, high-speed memory located inside the CPU to improve data access time.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a hardware component?
questions.explanation: The operating system is a software component, while RAM, CPU, and ROM are hardware components.
